result.execSummary:
The defendant David A Hanaway was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Criminal Damage to Property [Modifiers: Repeater], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.01(1).
  • Resisting or Obstructing an Officer [Modifiers: Repeater], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.41(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
Each count concur.
8/9/16: Court orders probation revoked and prison sentences imposed.

miscConds.notes: Paid in full by bond.  $200 DNA surcharge remitted.
Maintain absolute sobriety. No bars taverrns businesses that primary business is sale of alcohol.
Parenting classes. Completion of certified domestic violence treatment.  Any other conditions DOC, Probation/Parole Department may impose.
Maintain full-time employment/education or combination of or be seeking same, and treatment.

timeConds.notes: W/huber. Stayed for use by agent.

miscConds.notes: All other conditions are the same as count 1 except for jail.
